meanings.definition: To make a friend of; to win the favor of; to gain the friendship of.
meanings.sent1: She tried to amate her new classmates by sharing her snacks with them.
meanings.sent2: He hoped to amate his neighbor by helping with her garden.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to amate the cat by offering a toy as a peace offering.
meanings.sent4: The magician's tricks seemed to amate the audience, winning their favor.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture of offering a seat helped amate the elderly lady waiting at the bus stop.

meanings.definition: To love; to be in love with.
meanings.sent1: He truly amates spending time with his family on weekends.
meanings.sent2: She amates the beautiful sunset over the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The young couple's constant giggling showed how much they amate each other.
meanings.sent4: The artist amates the way colors blend on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The child amates the feeling of sand between their toes at the beach.
